description: Metadata for multiple World Bank Group databases.

ibrd_lending.description: Details for ibrd_lending. Latest available data on Loans and Guarantees provided since inception. Note: IDs starting with IBRDB and IBRDG are 'Guarantees' and the rest are 'Loans'. The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) loans are public and publicly guaranteed debt extended by the World Bank Group. IBRD loans are made to, or guaranteed by, countries / economies that are members of IBRD. IBRD may also make loans to IFC. IBRD lends at market rates. Data are in U.S. dollars calculated using historical rates. This dataset contains the latest available snapshot of the Statement of Loans. The World Bank complies with all sanctions applicable to World Bank transactions.

end_of_period.description: End of Period Date represents the date as of which balances are shown in the report.

loan_number.description: For IBRD, a loan number consists of the organization prefix (IBRD) and a five-character label that uniquely identifies the loan within the organization. IDs starting with IBRDB and IBRDG are 'Guarantees' and the rest are 'Loans'.

region.description: World Bank Region to which country / economy and loan belong. Country / Economy lending is grouped into regions based on the current World Bank administrative (rather than geographic) region where project implementation takes place. The Other Region is used for loans to IFC.

country_economy_code.description: Country / Economy Code according to the World Bank country / economy list. Might be different from the ISO country / economy code.

country_economy.description: Country / Economy Code according to the World Bank country / economy list. Might be different from the ISO country / economy code.

borrower.description: The representative of the borrower to which the Bank loan is made.

guarantor_country_economy_code.description: Country / Economy Code of the Guarantor according to the World Bank country / economy list. Might be different from the ISO country / economy code.

guarantor.description: The Guarantor guarantees repayment to the Bank if the borrower does not repay.

loan_type.description: A type of loan/loan instrument for which distinctive accounting and/or other actions need to be performed.

project_id.description: A Bank project is referenced by a project ID (Pxxxxxxx). More than one loan, credit, or grant may be associated with one Project ID.
project_id.query_notes: Primary column for the table. Include this in your SQL query when querying IBRD loans.

project_name.query_notes: Include this in your SQL query when querying IBRD loans.

original_principal_amount_usd.description: The original US dollar amount of the loan that is committed and approved.
original_principal_amount_usd.query_notes: Use this as your primary amount column for SQL query when querying IBRD loans, unless the user asks for a different amount column. Include this column in your SQL query when querying IBRD loans, unless you are including some other amount column as per the user query.

cancelled_amount_usd.description: The portion of the undisbursed balance which has been cancelled (i.e. no longer available for future disbursement). Cancellations include terminations (where approved loan agreements were never signed).

undisbursed_amount_usd.description: The amount of a loan commitment that is still available to be drawn down. These currency amounts have been converted to US dollars at the exchange rates applicable at the End of Period date.

disbursed_amount_usd.description: The amount that has been disbursed from a loan commitment in equivalent US dollars calculated at the exchange rate on the value date of the individual disbursements.

repaid_to_ibrd_usd.description: Total principal amounts paid or prepaid to IBRD in US dollars, calculated at the exchange rate on the value date of the individual repayments.

due_to_ibrd_usd.description: Where the exchange adjustment is shown separately, this is the amount disbursed and outstanding expressed as a stock of debt in historical US Dollars. Otherwise, this is the amount due and outstanding as of the End of Period date.

exchange_adjustment_usd.description: Where the exchange adjustment is shown separately, this is the amount disbursed and outstanding expressed as a stock of debt in historical US Dollars. Otherwise, this is the amount due and outstanding as of the End of Period date.

borrower's_obligation_usd.description: The Borrower Obligation is the outstanding balance for the loan as of the end of period date in US dollars equivalent. The Borrower's Obligation includes the amounts outstanding Due to 3rd parties.

sold_3rd_party_usd.description: Portion of loan sold to a third party.

repaid_3rd_party_usd.description: Amount repaid to a third party.

due_3rd_party_usd.description: Amount due to a third party.

loans_held_usd.description: The sum of the disbursed and outstanding amounts (net of repayments, i.e. Due to IBRD) plus undisbursed available amounts.

first_repayment_date.description: The date on which principal repayment starts.

last_repayment_date.description: The date specified in the loan/credit agreement (amended for any partial prepayments) on which the last principal installment must be repaid by the Borrower.

agreement_signing_date.description: The date specified in the loan/credit agreement (amended for any partial prepayments) on which the last principal installment must be repaid by the Borrower.

board_approval_date.description: The date the World Bank approves the loan.

effective_date_most_recent.description: The date on which a legal agreement becomes effective, or is expected to become effective.

closed_date_most_recent.description: The date specified in the legal agreement (or extension) after which the Bank may, by notice to the borrower, terminate the right to make withdrawals from the loan account.

last_disbursement_date.description: The date on which the last disbursement was made (prior to the end of period date).

ida_lending.description: Details for ida_lending. Latest available data on Credits, Grants and Guarantees provided since inception. Note: IDs starting with IDAB and IDAG are 'Guarantees', IDs starting with IDAD, IDAH and IDAE are 'Grants' and the rest are 'Credits'. The International Development Association (IDA) credits are public and publicly guaranteed debt extended by the World Bank Group. IDA provides development credits, grants and guarantees to its recipient member countries / economies to help meet their development needs. Credits from IDA are at concessional rates. Data are in U.S. dollars calculated using historical rates. This dataset contains the latest available snapshot of the IDA Statement of Credits and Grants. The World Bank complies with all sanctions applicable to World Bank transactions.

end_of_period.description: End of Period Date represents the date as of which balances are shown in the report.

credit_number.description: For IDA, credits, grants or guarantee number consists of the organization prefix (IDA) and a five-character label that uniquely identifies the ID within the organization. IDs starting with IDAB and IDAG are 'Guarantees', IDs starting with IDAD, IDAH and IDAE are 'Grants' and the rest are 'Credits'.

region.description: Country / Economy lending is grouped into regions based on the current World Bank administrative (rather than geographic) region where project implementation takes place. The Other Region is used for loans to the IFC.

country_economy_code.description: Country / Economy Code according to the World Bank country / economy list. Might be different from the ISO country / economy code.

country_economy.description: Country / Economy to which loan has been issued. Loans to the IFC are included under the country / economy “World”.

borrower.description: The representative of the borrower to which the Bank loan is made.

service_charge_rate.description: Current Interest rate or service charge applied to loan. For loans that could have more than one interest rate (e.g. FSL or SCL fixed rate loans), the interest rate is shown as “0”.

currency_of_commitment.description: The currency in which a borrower’s loan, credit, grant or trust fund is denominated.

project_id.description: A Bank project is referenced by a project ID (Pxxxxxxx). More than one loan, credit, or grant may be associated with one Project ID.
project_id.query_notes: Primary column for the table. Include this in your SQL query when querying IDA loans.

project_name.query_notes: Include this in your SQL query when querying IDA loans.

original_principal_amount_usd.description: The original US dollar amount of the loan that is committed and approved.
original_principal_amount_usd.query_notes: Use this as your primary amount column for SQL query when querying IDA loans, unless the user asks for a different amount column. Include this column in your SQL query when querying IDA loans, unless you are including some other amount column as per the user query.

cancelled_amount_usd.description: The portion of the undisbursed balance which has been cancelled (i.e. no longer available for future disbursement). Cancellations include terminations (where approved loan agreements were never signed).

undisbursed_amount_usd.description: The amount of a loan commitment that is still available to be drawn down. These currency amounts have been converted to US dollars at the exchange rates applicable at the End of Period date.

disbursed_amount_usd.description: The amount that has been disbursed from a loan commitment in equivalent US dollars calculated at the exchange rate on the value date of the individual disbursements.

repaid_to_ida_usd.description: Total principal amounts paid or prepaid to IDA in US dollars, calculated at the exchange rate on the value date of the individual repayments.Repaid to IDA amounts include amounts written off under the Multilateral Debt Relief Initiative (MDRI).

due_to_ida_usd.description: The amount due and outstanding as of the End of Period date.

exchange_adjustment_usd.description: The increase (decrease) in value of disbursed and outstanding amount due to exchange rate fluctuations; includes exchange adjustments on the amounts Due to 3rd parties.

borrowers_obligation_usd.description: The Borrower Obligation is the outstanding balance for the loan as of the end of period date in US dollars equivalent. The Borrower's Obligation includes the amounts outstanding Due to 3rd parties.

sold_3rd_party_usd.description: Portion of loan sold to a third party.

repaid_3rd_party_usd.description: Amount repaid to a third party.

due_3rd_party_usd.description: Amount due to a third party.

credits_held_usd.description: The sum of the disbursed and outstanding amounts (net of repayments, i.e. Due to IBRD/IDA) plus undisbursed available amounts.

first_repayment_date.description: The date on which principal repayment starts.

last_repayment_date.description: The date specified in the loan/credit agreement (amended for any partial prepayments) on which the last principal installment must be repaid by the Borrower.

agreement_signing_date.description: The date the borrower and the Bank sign the loan agreement.

board_approval_date.description: The date the World Bank approves the loan.

effective_date_most_recent.description: The date on which a legal agreement becomes effective, or is expected to become effective.

closed_date_most_recent.description: The date specified in the legal agreement (or extension) after which the Bank may, by notice to the borrower, terminate the right to make withdrawals from the loan account.

last_disbursement_date.description: The date on which the last disbursement was made (prior to the end of period date).

ifc_investments.description: Details for ifc_investments. List of projects from inception to date. IFC continues to develop new financial products that enable companies to manage risk and broaden their access to foreign and domestic capital markets. Our broad suite of investment services can ease poverty and spur long-term growth by promoting sustainable enterprises, encouraging entrepreneurship, and mobilizing resources that wouldn’t otherwise be available.

date_disclosed.description: Date when the record was first disclosed.

project_name.description: Name of an investment project - discrete unit of work associated with provision of financial product to a client.

project_number.description: Numeric code that uniquely identifies a project.

product_line.description: Identifies IFC Financial Product. This is the highest level of classification to be applied to IFC product. Each IFC product must be assigned one and only one product type.

country.description: Country where investment and/or advisory services are executed and/or utilized.

ifc_country_code.description: Country code according to IFC Code list.

industry.description: Name that follows the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) schema identifying a distinct economic segment, and is the lowest classification level.

environmental_category.description: Code indicating nature and extent of environmental and social assessment needed fro investment project as defined in IFC's Policy on Environmental and Social Sustainability.

department.description: World Bank Group organizational entity within a Vice Presidency, comprised of one or more units and/or divisions.

projected_board_date.description: Summary of Project Information is prepared and distributed to the public in advance of the IFC Board of Directors’ consideration of the proposed transaction. Board dates are estimates only.

ifc_approval_date.description: Date when the project was approved by IFC.

ifc_signed_date.description: Date when the project was signed by IFC.

ifc_invested_date.description: Date when the project was invested by IFC.

ifc_investment_for_risk_management_milli.description: Risk Management - product designed to hedge the financial risk of IFC client(s) using derivative products.

ifc_investment_for_guarantee_million_usd.description: Guarantee - promise from one entity to assume responsibility for the payment of a financial obligation of another entity if such other entity fails to perform. A guarantee is a contingent liability of the guarantor.

ifc_investment_for_loan_million_usd.description: Loans - money advances to a client, to be repaid at a later date, usually with interest and/or fees.

ifc_investment_for_equity_million_usd.description: Equity - Ownership interest in a corporation or enterprise that represents a claim on the assets of the entity in proportion to the number and class of shares owned.

total_ifc_investment_as_approved_by_boar.description: Sum of project's financial product(s) prior to approval and approved.
total_ifc_investment_as_approved_by_boar.query_notes: Use this as your primary amount column for SQL query when querying IFC investments, unless the user asks for a different amount column. Include this column in your SQL query when querying IFC investments, unless you are including some other amount column as per the user query.

wb_country_code.description: Country code according to WBG Code list. Might be different from ISO codes.

as_of_date.description: Date when this snapshot was taken.

ifc_advisory.description: Details for ifc_advisory. Private sector development requires more than just finance. Experience shows the powerful role advisory services can play in unlocking investment and helping businesses expand and create jobs. To help the private sector in emerging markets, IFC provides advice, problem solving, and training to companies, industries, and governments. Our experience shows that companies need more than financial investment to thrive—they need a regulatory environment that enables entrepreneurship, and advice on business best practices. Our work includes advising national and local governments on how to improve their investment climate and strengthen basic infrastructure. Governments account for around half of our advisory projects. We also help investment clients improve corporate governance and become more sustainable.

disclosure_date.description: Date when the record was first disclosed.

project_number.description: Numeric code that uniquely identifies a project.

project_name.description: Name of an advisory project - discrete unit of work associated with provision of service to a client.

project_url.description: Link to a project page on IFC Projects website.

country.description: Country where advisory services are executed and/or utilized.

ifc_country_code.description: Country code according to IFC Code list.

ifc_region.description: Geographic region. The term 'World' describes projects spanning multiple regions.

estimated_total_budget_usd.description: Project budget includes all project-funded activities.
estimated_total_budget_usd.query_notes: Use this as your primary amount column for SQL query when querying IFC advisory, unless the user asks for a different amount column. Include this column in your SQL query when querying IFC advisory, unless you are including some other amount column as per the user query.

department.description: World Bank Group organizational entity within a Vice Presidency, comprised of one or more units and/or divisions.

ifc_approval_date.description: Date when the project was approved by IFC.

projected_start_date.description: Date when the project is expected to start.

wb_country_code.description: Country code according to WBG Code list. Might be different from ISO codes.

as_of_date.description: Date when this snapshot was taken.

miga_guarantees.description: The Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) was created in 1988 as a member of the World Bank Group to promote foreign direct investment into emerging countries to support economic growth, reduce poverty, and improve people’s lives. MIGA fulfills this mandate by offering political risk insurance (guarantees) to investors and lenders, covering risks including expropriation, breach of contract, currency transfer restriction, war and civil disturbance, and non-honoring of sovereign financial obligations. Project briefs are disclosed after Board consideration and contract signing and reflect the terms of the project at the time of contract signature.

issued_fy.description: Year of issuance of the guarantee.

host_country.description: Country where the project is located.

host_country_code.description: Country code according to WBG Code list. Might be different from ISO codes.

host_region_code.description: Region code according to WBG Code list. Might be different from ISO codes.

gross_issued_amount_usd.query_notes: Use this as your primary amount column for SQL query when querying MIGA guarantees, unless the user asks for a different amount column. Include this column in your SQL query when querying MIGA guarantees, unless you are including some other amount column as per the user query.

project_start_date.description: Date when the project is expected to start.

project_expiration_date.description: Date when the project is expected to expire.
